column1: TA4.28;By 31 December 2030
column2: in each safe and secure parking area at least four publicly accessible recharging stations dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an individual power output of at least 100 kW are deployed.;TA4.25;+;The deployment of recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that at least 1.3 kW of power output is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered
column3: as it will increase the overall availability of charging infrastructure. This
column4: in turn
column5: will support the growth of electric vehicles and reduce greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA4.29;By 31 December 2030
column2: in each urban node publicly accessible recharging points dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles with an aggregated power output of at least 1 800 kW are deployed
column3: provided by recharging stations with an individual power output of at least 150 kW.;TA4.25;+;The deployment of recharging points for heavy-duty electric vehicles in urban nodes will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that at least 1.3 kW of power output is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered
column4: as it will increase the overall availability of charging infrastructure and support the growth of electric vehicles.

column1: TA4.30;Member States shall ensure that
column2: by 31 December 2030
column3: at least one publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling station is deployed in each urban node.;TA5.7;+;The deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations in urban nodes will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as hydrogen fuel cell vehicles can provide a low-carbon alternative to traditional fossil fuel-based transportation.

column1: TA4.31;Member States shall ensure that
column2: by 31 December 2030
column3: publicly accessible hydrogen refuelling stations with a total capacity of at least 1 tonne per day
column4: and equipped with at least a 700 bar dispenser
column5: are deployed at least every 200 km along the TEN-T core network.;TA5.7;+;The deployment of hydrogen refuelling stations along the TEN-T core network will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column6: as hydrogen fuel cell vehicles can provide a low-carbon alternative to traditional fossil fuel-based transportation and support the growth of low-carbon transportation.

column1: TA4.32;States shall ensure that
column2: at all airports of the TEN-T core network and TEN-T comprehensive network
column3: the provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft is ensured by 31 December 2029.;TA5.7;+;The provision of electricity supply to stationary aircraft will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from aircraft operations and support the growth of low-carbon aviation.

column1: TA4.33;Member States shall ensure that at least one installation providing shore-side electricity supply to inland waterway vessels is deployed at all TEN-T core inland waterway ports by 1 January 2025.;TA5.7;+;The deployment of shore-side electricity supply installations for inland waterway vessels will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column2: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from inland waterway transportation and support the growth of low-carbon transportation.

column1: TA4.34;Member States shall ensure that a minimum shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships is provided in TEN-T maritime ports.;TA5.7;+;The provision of shore-side electricity supply for seagoing container ships and seagoing passenger ships will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column2: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from maritime transportation and support the growth of low-carbon shipping.

column1: TA5.2;Reduce overall EU sales of antimicrobials for farmed animals and in aquaculture by 50% by 2030.;TA5.4;-;The reduction of antimicrobial sales for farmed animals and in aquaculture may have a negative impact on the target of reducing the use of more hazardous pesticides by 50%
column2: as the use of antimicrobials and pesticides can be interconnected
column3: and reducing one may lead to an increase in the other.

column1: TA5.3;Reduce nutrient losses by at least 50%
column2: while ensuring that there is no deterioration in soil fertility.;TA5.4;+;The reduction of nutrient losses will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing the use of more hazardous pesticides by 50%
column3: as reducing nutrient losses can lead to a decrease in the use of synthetic fertilizers and pesticides
column4: which can contribute to soil pollution and harm the environment.

column1: TA5.4;Reduce by 50% the use of more hazardous pesticides;TA5.3;+;The reduction of more hazardous pesticides will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing nutrient losses by at least 50%
column2: as the use of pesticides can contribute to soil pollution and nutrient losses
column3: and reducing their use can lead to more sustainable agricultural practices.

column1: TA5.5;Reduce by 50% the use and risk of chemical pesticides;TA5.3;+;The reduction of chemical pesticides will likely have a positive impact on the target of reducing nutrient losses by at least 50%
column2: as the use of chemical pesticides can contribute to soil pollution and nutrient losses
column3: and reducing their use can lead to more sustainable agricultural practices.

column1: TA5.6;Ensure that agriculture
column2: fisheries and aquaculture
column3: and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030;TA5.7;+;The contribution of agriculture
column4: fisheries
column5: and aquaculture to reducing net greenhouse gas emissions will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column7: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column8: as it will support the growth of low-carbon agriculture and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the food value chain.

column1: TA5.7;Ensure that agriculture
column2: fisheries and aquaculture
column3: and the food value chain contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030;TA5.6;+;The target of ensuring that agriculture
column4: fisheries
column5: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030 will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that the food value chain contributes to reducing net greenhouse gas emissions
column6: as it will support the growth of low-carbon agriculture and reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the food value chain.

column1: TA5.8;Water: Preserving freshwater
column2: boosting water reuse in agriculture;TA5.9;+;The preservation of freshwater and boosting of water reuse in agriculture will likely have a positive impact on the target of increasing organic farming to at least 25% of total farmland by 2030
column3: as organic farming often requires more water-efficient practices and can contribute to preserving freshwater resources.

column1: TA5.9;Increase organic farming with the aim to achieve at least 25% of total farmland under organic farming by 2030;TA5.8;+;The increase in organic farming will likely have a positive impact on the target of preserving freshwater and boosting water reuse in agriculture
column2: as organic farming often requires more water-efficient practices and can contribute to preserving freshwater resources.

column1: TA5.10;Increase renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector;TA5.6;+;The increase in renewable energy in the agriculture and food sector will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as renewable energy can reduce greenhouse gas emissions from the food value chain.

column1: TA5.11;Biodiversity conservation and restoration of natural resources: Protect the environment and restore natural resources;TA6.1;+;The conservation and restoration of natural resources will likely have a positive impact on the target of preserving and protecting biodiversity
column2: as it will support the growth of ecosystems and reduce the loss of biodiversity.

column1: TA6.1;Preserve and protect biodiversity;TA5.11;+;The preservation and protection of biodiversity will likely have a positive impact on the target of conserving and restoring natural resources
column2: as it will support the growth of ecosystems and reduce the loss of biodiversity.

column1: TA3.51;Member States shall ensure that waste management operators achieve a yearly target for the recycling of plastics of at least 30 % of the total weight of plastics contained in the vehicles delivered to the waste management operators.;TA4.25;-;The recycling of plastics from vehicles may have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that at least 1.3 kW of power output is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered
column2: as the recycling of plastics may lead to an increase in the use of recycled materials in the production of new vehicles
column3: which could lead to an increase in the weight of vehicles and a subsequent increase in energy consumption.

column1: TA3.52;At least 20% of the carbon used in the chemical and plastic products should be from sustainable non-fossil sources by 2030;TA4.25;-;The use of sustainable non-fossil sources in the production of chemical and plastic products may have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that at least 1.3 kW of power output is provided through publicly accessible recharging stations for each light-duty battery electric vehicle registered
column2: as the production of these products may lead to an increase in energy consumption and greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA4.3;The yearly average GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship during a reporting period shall be reduced
column2: compared to the reference value;TA5.7;+;The reduction of GHG intensity of the energy used on board by a ship will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column3: fisheries
column4: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column5: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from maritime transportation.

column1: TA4.5;Aviation fuel suppliers shall also ensure that Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) made available to aircraft operators at each Union airport will be at least 2% from 2025;TA5.7;+;The use of Sustainable Aviation Fuel (SAF) will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from aviation.

column1: TA4.6;Of the SAF targets reported above
column2: synthetic aviation fuels should represent a minimum share of 1.2% from 2030;TA5.7;+;The use of synthetic aviation fuels will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column3: fisheries
column4: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column5: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from aviation.

column1: TA4.7;Each Member State shall set an obligation on fuel suppliers to ensure that: (B) the combined share of advanced biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part A of Annex IX and of renewable fuels of non-biological origin in the energy supplied to the transport sector is at least 1% in 2025 and 5.5% in 2030;TA5.7;+;The use of advanced biofuels and biogas will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transportation.

column1: TA4.8;Member States with maritime ports shall endeavour to ensure that as of 2030 the share of renewable fuels of non-biological origin (RFNBOs) in the total amount of energy supplied to the maritime transport sector is at least 1.2%;TA5.7;+;The use of renewable fuels of non-biological origin (RFNBOs) in the maritime transport sector will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from maritime transportation.

column1: TA4.9;Cut the emissions of transport sector by 90% by 2050 relative to 1990;TA5.7;+;The reduction of emissions from the transport sector will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transportation.

column1: TA4.10;EU fisheries are encouraged to continue the positive trend
column2: as observed for the period 2009-2019
column3: towards reducing fuel intensity by reducing the fossil-fuel consumption per kg of landed product for at least an additional 15% for the period 2019-2030;TA5.7;+;The reduction of fuel intensity in EU fisheries will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column4: fisheries
column5: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column6: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from fisheries.

column1: TA4.11;Reduce the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations by at least 10% within 7 years;TA5.7;-;The reduction of the average door-to-door cost of combined transport operations may have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it may lead to an increase in transportation activities and subsequent greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA4.13;For [...] “urban buses” manufacturers shall comply with the 90% (in the reporting period 2030-2034) and 100% (as from 2035) minimum shares in their fleet of new heavy-duty vehicles;TA5.7;+;The use of zero-emission urban buses will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from urban transportation.

column1: TA4.15;The average CO2 emissions of the Union fleet of new heavy-duty motor vehicles [...]
column2: off-road vehicles and off-road special purpose vehicles shall be reduced by the following percentages compared to the average CO2 emissions of the reporting period of the year 2019;TA5.7;+;The reduction of CO2 emissions from new heavy-duty motor vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column3: fisheries
column4: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column5: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transportation.

column1: TA4.18;The share of biofuels and biogas produced from the feedstock listed in Part B of Annex IX in the energy content of fuels and electricity supplied to the transport sector shall
column2: except in Cyprus and Malta
column3: be limited to 1.7%;TA5.7;-;The limitation of biofuels and biogas produced from certain feedstocks may have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column4: fisheries
column5: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column6: as it may lead to an increase in the use of fossil fuels and subsequent greenhouse gas emissions.

column1: TA4.19;The yearly quantity of aviation fuel uplifted by a given aircraft operator at a given Union airport shall be at least 90% of the yearly aviation fuel required;TA5.7;-;The increase in aviation fuel uplifted may have a negative impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column2: fisheries
column3: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column4: as it may lead to an increase in greenhouse gas emissions from aviation.

column1: TA4.20;In the first phase
column2: from 2020 up to 2024
column3: the strategic objective is to install at least 6 GW of renewable hydrogen electrolysers in the EU;TA5.7;+;The installation of renewable hydrogen electrolysers will likely have a positive impact on the target of ensuring that agriculture
column4: fisheries
column5: and aquaculture contribute to the target of reducing net greenhouse gas emissions to at least 55% below 1990 levels by 2030
column6: as it will reduce greenhouse gas emissions from transportation and industry.

column1: TA4.25;Member States shall ensure that
column2: at the end of each year
column3: the following power output targets are met cumulatively;TA4.28;+;The deployment of recharging stations for light-duty battery electric vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the target of deploying recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles
column4: as it will increase the overall availability of charging infrastructure and support the growth of electric vehicles.

column1: TA4.26;Member States shall ensure that along the TEN-T core and comprehensive network
column2: publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to light-duty vehicles deployed in each direction of travel with a maximum distance of 60 km in-between them;TA4.28;+;The deployment of recharging pools for light-duty vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the target of deploying recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles
column3: as it will increase the overall availability of charging infrastructure and support the growth of electric vehicles.

column1: TA4.27;Member States shall ensure that
column2: by 31 December 2030 (with intermediate 2025 and 2027 targets)
column3: along the TEN-T core road network
column4: publicly accessible recharging pools dedicated to heavy-duty electric vehicles are deployed;TA4.28;+;The deployment of recharging pools for heavy-duty electric vehicles will likely have a positive impact on the target of deploying recharging stations for heavy-duty electric vehicles
column5: as it will increase the overall availability of charging infrastructure and support the growth of electric vehicles.
